alert.note: Alert for Benton; Maries; Miller; Morgan (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 02 at 10:11PM CDT until August 03 at 4:00AM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM CDT THURSDAY FOR NORTHEASTERN BENTON, MARIES, MILLER AND SOUTHERN MORGAN COUNTIES... At 1011 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across parts of the warned area. Up to 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches will be possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. This includes the following low water crossings... Blue Springs Creek at Highway Z, Little Tavern Creek at County Road 220, Montague Creek at County Road 510, Maries River at County Road 211, Weimer Creek at White School Road, Saline Creek at Square Line Road and Dry Fork at County Road 407. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
